alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Inlet Area; Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 4:38PM PST until January 13 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Additional snowfall of 1 to 3 inches. Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 0 degrees to 5 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Snow and slush on roadways could make travel difficult. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is likely to taper off later this evening. The coldest wind chill values will be felt primarily at night.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Inlet Area; Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca
